intro: Pilosella heothina, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Pilosella heothina has hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in meadows and open slopes at high elevations.
